name: 旅客飲食行為研究
description: This course is designed to acquaint students with fundamental concepts and theories in the field of tourist food consumption and food tourism. A multidisciplinary approach will be adopted, which synthesizes relevant perspectives, including food consumption, hospitality and tourism, and sociology, to enable students to gain a thorough understanding of tourist food consumption. Various topics will be covered, such as globalization and food consumption in tourism, food tourism as a form of special interest tourism, food events, and cooking school holidays. Students will learn about best practices in the hospitality industry in both domestic and international contexts. Through a final project, students will have the chance to apply concepts and theories they have learned in a tourist food consumption / food tourism study.
goals: Develop an interdisciplinary understanding of tourist food consumption behavior.
Aware of the influence of globalization on food supply and tourist food consumption.
Recognize the relationship among place, environment, and food.
Understand the nature and importance of various types of food tourists.
Acquire knowledge on the design of various food tourism activities.
Apply the knowledge acquired into the development of a tourist food consumption / food tourism study.

methodologies.note: Introduce students to key concepts and theories through lecturing.
Allow students to discuss issues and trends in the field through group discussion.
Facilitate problem-based learning (PBL) through a final group project.
Enable cooperative learning (CL) through a final group project.
Provide students with the opportunity to experience or explore tourist food consumption behavior / food tourism through a field trip.
Familiarize students with latest audio / visual materials relevant to studies in the field.
Introduce students to contemporary issues and best practices in the field through case studies.

grading.note: Individual Mini-task Presentation: TFCB Concepts or Theories (15-20 mins)
Final exam (to test students’ understanding on key concepts or theories in the field)
Individual Sharing: Food Story / Culture (5-10 mins)
Mid-term Group Presentation & Competition – Design a themed “Food Tour” (or Food Tour + Cooking Class)
